page.title: 20Crockenhill-The future.
page.content: THREATS TO ITS IDENTITY.Concerns are:- 1)Loss of Green Belt.Plans for houses on derelict orchards ,the advance of Swanley over the A20,development near M25 intersection,relaxation of government policy.2)Deterioration of G reen Belt.Subdivision of fields for horse paddocks, "rurban fringe"development, over intensification of farming to the detriment of wildlife. 3)Impact of M25.More traffic noise,loss of access to countryside,the possibility of slip-roads to A20(especially if the Channel Tunnel is built).4)Nuisance from through traffic volume is up due to ASDA and roadworks BUT there is still a community spirit which rallies round against threats and village identity will be further stengthened when Crockenhill has its Parish Council in 1987.
